Clients and Partnerships

Building Meaningful Relationships

We work collaboratively with clients to enhance evaluation practice and research impact through meaningful partnerships built on mutual respect and shared learning.

Clients

Using Evidence has been privileged to work with a diverse range of organizations committed to evidence-based decision making and evaluation excellence.

International Organizations
  • Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
  • World Health Organization
  • IUCN
  • Green Climate Fund
  • UNESCO Montevideo Office
  • ELRHA: Solutions to Complex Humanitarian Problems
Canadian Organizations
  • International Development Research Centre
  • Global Affairs Canada
  • National Research Council
  • First Nations and Inuit Health Branch
  • Ontario Brain Institute
  • The Integrated Knowledge Translation Research Network
Foundations & NGOs
  • MasterCard Foundation
  • CAPSI: Centre on African Philanthropy and Social Investment
  • The Association of Maternal and Child Health Programs
  • International Confederation of Midwives
Government & Research
  • UK Aid, Department for International Development
  • Department of Technology, Research & Higher Education – Government of Indonesia
  • Agricultural Science & Technology Indicators Program

Partnerships

Partnerships are occasions in which I have joined with another research group or consultancy in the delivery of a project. These collaborations bring together complementary expertise and expand our capacity to serve clients effectively.

Strategic Partnership Collaborations
  • Capability - Helmets
  • Cindy Weeks Consulting - Rideau Hall Foundation
  • EnCompass LLC - UN Women
  • Itad - Global Challenges Research Fund
  • Knowledge Sector Initiative - RTI International for DFAT Australia
  • Migunani - RTI International
  • ORS-Impact - Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
  • Sambodhi Research and Communications - Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
  • The Evaluation Centre for Complex Health Interventions
  • Universalia Management Group - FAO

Our Approach

We believe in collaborative relationships built on mutual respect, shared learning, and a commitment to making evaluation useful and useable.
